intro: Neobartsia inaequalis subsp. inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal neobartsia, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral arrangement compared to other members of the species.
